results.title: Corporate Globalisation
results.creator_credit: Pip Starr, Campbell Manderson and SKA TV
results.brief_description: A look at the negative effects of corporate globalization has on the environment and human rights laws. Screened as a news story for SKA TV’s Access News, a grass-roots alternative to mainstream news and current affairs, broadcast weekly on Melbourne’s Community Television station Channel 31 since 1994.

results.title: Corot 1796-1875
results.brief_description: A survey of the works of Corot, a painter of joy and happiness who opened the door for the Impressionists by mingling the dream-life of Romanticism with the clean cool lines of the classical tradition.

results.title: Coronation day
results.creator_credit: United Nations Films, United Nations. Office of Public Information and Thorold Dickinson
results.brief_description: Captures the coronation day of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II on the 2nd June, 1953. Shows the procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey, the coronation service, the procession back to the Palace and Her Majesty’s appearance on the balcony to watch the R.A.F. fly-past. Includes a glimpse of Sir Robert Menzies at the ceremony. Commentary by James McKechnie, script by Gerald Sanger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United Nations Films, United Nations. Office of Public Information and Thorold Dickinson

results.title: Coronation ceremony
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, Central Office of Information and Hindle Marriott Edgar
results.brief_description: A film about the significance of the coronation ceremony. The opening sequences show, through old prints, pictures and tapestries, the history of the coronation ritual, and its gradual development to its present form. The film then gives, by means of black and white drawings, an artist’s impression of the coronation of Queen Elizabeth II. Music composed by John Gardner and performed by the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by John Hollingsworth. Story by Dermot Morrah, spoken by Leo Genn. Original drawings by James Gardiner and R. Jeffryes.

results.title: Coronary Heart Disease
results.brief_description: Coronary heart disease accounts for a major proportion of deaths in the developed world. The tragedy is that much of this disease is preventable. This 3 part video presents a clear picture of the disease and is produced with the support of the British Heart Foundation.
results.description: Coronary heart disease accounts for a major proportion of deaths in the developed world. The tragedy is that much of this disease is preventable. This 3 part video presents a clear picture of the disease and is produced with the support of the British Heart Foundation.

results.title: Coronary counter attack
results.brief_description: Outlines heart disease risk factors, and argues that aerobic exercise will reduce these risks. Gives guidelines for such selected activities as jogging, swimming, bicycling, walking, rope jumping and cross-country skiing. Featuring Dr Kenneth H. Cooper.

results.title: Cornish Valley
results.creator_credit: Verity Films and Great Britain. Ministry of Information
results.brief_description: A study of family life on farms in the Coombe Valley near the border of north Cornwall and Devon, an area fairly typical of the south-west peninsula of England, with open, wind-swept uplands, deep sheltered valleys, steep slopes and small fields.

results.title: Cornice mould and fibrous plaster cast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
The architect’s drawing, paper template, zinc template, stock and horse - these are the stages that produce the tool that the plasterer will use. The stages of forming the mould are demonstrated in detail, the core and the final coat without muffle.

results.title: Cornflakes for tea
results.creator_credit: Andromeda Productions, Tom Broadbridge and John Colquhoun
results.brief_description: Dramatization of how a family living in high-rise inner city flats manage to cope with caring for each other when first their mother and then their father abandon them. Provides many points which could act as stimulus for discussion including perspectives on family relationships, contrasts on single parent and conventional nuclear families, welfare workers and their role, supportive community members, and the warm relationship of the central characters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andromeda Productions, Tom Broadbridge and John Colquhoun
